content: onopordum copyright © general hogbuffer 2013 onopordum acanthium is the latin name for the cotton thistle the heraldic flower of scotland i wanted to design a flower motiv sock that would still be suitable for men well scottish men at least the jury s out on that one but i am happy with the result especially as we have further scottish elements such as the use of classic fairisle techniques and a variation of the argyll diamond check please make sure you have read the whole of the instructions before starting to make sure you have understood what you will be doing and to make you aware of all the options size because the main thistle design is 18 sts wide i am only providing instructions for one size a sock with 72 sts both of the smaller designs have a repeat of 12 sts so short of completely re-designing the sock i would suggest any adjustments in size should be made by going either a needle size up or down just for comparison i would normally knit a plain sock with 2 5 mm needles over 64 sts in this yarn for the stranded work i had to go up to 2 75 mm and 72 sts to have a comparable fit material sock wool in 4 ply / fingering weight in four coordinating colours my sample has been knit in regia solid 4 ply i always wanted to do a sock in shades of grey marl but this would also look good in clear bright colours or in shades of purple and olive for example you could also use more colours if you wish and i have also included an alternative version that uses only 2 colours for everyone that hates sewing in ends needle size 2 75 mm or size needed to get the right dimensions you will need 2 circulars which i will call needle 1 and needle 2 these are equally easy to work on 4 dpn s though in that case your first and sec- ond needle will equal needle1 and your third and fourth will equal needle 2 in addition i have used size 2 5 mm for cuffs and heel but feel free to knit everything in the same size if changes needles seems to much bother further requirements - tapestry needle - stitch markers although you could do it without if they irritate you - 2 dpn s will be helpful even if you work on circs but they are not absolutely essential onopordum page 2 cuff using your favourite cast-on method and the colour of your choosing cast on 72 sts and close to a round taking care not to twist the cast-on work k2 p2 rib for as many rounds as you would like your cuff to be i did 24 rounds for my sam- ple on my sample socks i actually worked the cuff over 80 sts and decreased down to 72 sts in the first plain k
